moves.name: crushgrip
moves.battleEffect: The target is crushed with great force. The more HP the target has left, the greater this move's power.
moves.secondaryEffect: Increases damage the higher the target's Hit Points
moves.inDepthEffect: This attack's Base Power is anything from 1 up to 110 making it a fairly powerful attack to be used. The means of determining the Base Power however is set based on the Opponent's Hit Points. The higher its hit points the better. This does not refer to the Base Stats for the Hit Points but rather the opponent's HP relative to its maximum at the current point in time. With this in mind, a simple equation is made to determine the base power of the attack Base Power = 110 * (Opponent's Current HP / Opponent's Max HP) So for example if we were battling a Max IV'd, Max EV'd Torterra at Level 100 and it had just over half its HP remaining, it would be as such Base Power = 110 * (215 / 394) = 60.03 (2 d.p.) This shows that the best time to use Wring Out & Crush Grip would be at the start of a battle with any Pokémon, whether it has just been switched in or the battle is just beginning, in order to get the maximum Base Power. As the battle progresses, the power behind Wring Out & Crush Grip diminshes

moves.name: curse
moves.battleEffect: A move that works differently for the Ghost type than for all other types.
moves.secondaryEffect: Ghost type Pokémon: User loses half their maximum HP, and the opponent gets a Nightmare. Other Pokémon types: Raises user's Attack and Defense one stage. Lowers user's Speed one stage.

This will prevent damage and effects of almost all possible attacks that would be inflicted upon the user. There are a few moves and abilities which do break through this move The following moves are also unaffected by Protect & Detect: Doom Desire (delayed damage only), Future Sight (delayed damage only), Feint, Hyperspace Fury, Hyperspace Hole, Imprison, Perish Song, Phantom Force, Psych Up, Shadow Force, Transform

moves.secondaryEffect: User recovers half the damage inflicted on a sleeping opponent.

moves.name: drillpeck

moves.secondaryEffect: No effect.

moves.name: drillrun

moves.secondaryEffect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

moves.name: dualchop

moves.secondaryEffect: Attacks twice in a row.

moves.name: dynamicpunch

moves.secondaryEffect: May induce Confusion

moves.name: earthpower
moves.battleEffect: The user makes the ground under the target erupt with power. This may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.
moves.secondaryEffect: May lower opponent's Special Defense one stage.

moves.name: earthquake

moves.secondaryEffect: Hits everyone on the field.

moves.name: echoedvoice
moves.battleEffect: The user attacks the target with an echoing voice. If this move is used every turn, its power is increased.
moves.secondaryEffect: Ignores stat changes
moves.inDepthEffect: This move increases in power when used by y Pokémon on your side in the last turn. The increase is by 100%. If two Pokémon use it in Double or Triple Battles or it's used repeatedly, the second power is 80 and if a third Pokémon uses it, its Base Power is 160. If it's used a fourth time within the same two turns, it is capped at 200.

moves.name: eerieimpulse
moves.battleEffect: The user's body generates an eerie impulse. Exposing the target to it harshly lowers the target's Sp. Atk stat.
moves.secondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Special Attack two stages.

moves.name: eggbomb

moves.secondaryEffect: No effect.

moves.name: electricterrain
moves.battleEffect: The user electrifies the ground for five turns, powering up Electric-type moves. Pokémon on the ground no longer fall asleep.
moves.secondaryEffect: Activates Electric Terrain for 5 turns
moves.inDepthEffect: This move creates a terrain that helps Pokémon on the ground for 5 turns. It prevents the Pokémon from sleep and boosts the power of Electric-type moves on grounded Pokémon by 50%

moves.name: electrify
moves.battleEffect: If the target is electrified before it uses a move during that turn, the target's move becomes Electric type.
moves.secondaryEffect: Causes target's moves to become Electric-type for this turn

moves.name: electroball
moves.battleEffect: The user hurls an electric orb at the target. The faster the user is than the target, the greater the move's power.

moves.name: electroweb
moves.battleEffect: The user attacks and captures opposing Pokémon using an electric net. This lowers their Speed stat.
moves.secondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Speed one stage.

moves.name: embargo
moves.battleEffect: This move prevents the target from using its held item for five turns. Its Trainer is also prevented from using items on it.
moves.secondaryEffect: Prevents the target from using effects of its hold item for 5 turns

moves.name: ember
moves.battleEffect: The target is attacked with small flames. This may also leave the target with a burn.
moves.secondaryEffect: May induce burn.

moves.name: encore

moves.secondaryEffect: Opponent repeats the last move for 3 turns.
moves.inDepthEffect: This move causes the target to use their last used move for their next three turns. It will fail if the target's move failed, it hasn't used a move since being sent out, or if the last move they used has 0PP. It will also fail if the target used Encore, Mimic, Mirror Move, Sketch, Struggle or Transform in their last turn.

moves.name: endeavor
moves.battleEffect: This attack move cuts down the target's HP to equal the user's HP.
moves.secondaryEffect: Reduces the target's Hit Points to match the current Hit Points of the user.

moves.name: endure
moves.battleEffect: The user endures any attack with at least 1 HP. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
moves.secondaryEffect: Survives any Attack for one turn leaving at least 1 HP but may fail with successive uses.
moves.inDepthEffect: If used in succession with other protection moves, it has a 50% reduction in its success rate. Endure runs differently to the other moves. It doesn't prevent damage from attacks, but rather it prevents the Pokémon from fainting. When Endure is used and is successful, it will prevent the user from being knocked out by leaving the user with 1 Hit Point. This lasts the entire turn so it can receive multiple hits which end up doing no damage. This can be used with multiple strategies and moves including Reversal so that you can get your Hit Points down safely and then do massive damage Several items and abilities work in a similar manner to Endure; Sturdy leaves the user with 1 Hit Point if the user was to be knocked out when having full Hit Points. In a similar manner, the item Focus Sash works in an identical way. However, the other item; Focus Band will work regardless of Hit Points as it has a 10% chance of allowing the user to hold on from a move which would knock it out. Like the previous item, it'll leave it at 1 Hit Point.

moves.name: energyball
moves.battleEffect: The user draws power from nature and fires it at the target. This may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.
moves.secondaryEffect: May lower opponent's Special Defense one stage.

moves.name: entrainment

moves.secondaryEffect: Causes target's ability to match the user
moves.inDepthEffect: This move changes the opponent's abiliy to that of the user of this move. Doesn't work against Pokémon with the Truant, Zen Mode or Multitype abilities.

moves.name: eruption
moves.battleEffect: The user attacks opposing Pokémon with explosive fury. The lower the user's HP, the lower the move's power.
moves.secondaryEffect: Inflicts more damage when the user's HP is high.
moves.inDepthEffect: Power wise, this attack has a Base Power of 150 but that completely changes all depending on the HP. This is calculated in the manner below: Base Power = (Current HP * 150) / Max HP This gives it a maximum power of 150 and a Minimum of 1.

moves.name: explosion

moves.secondaryEffect: User faints

moves.name: extrasensory

moves.secondaryEffect: May cause opponent to flinch.

moves.secondaryEffect: Raises all user's stats by 2 stages

moves.name: fierydance

moves.name: fireblast

moves.inDepthEffect: This move, if used in Double/Triple Battles with Water Pledge, will create a rainbow which doubles the changes of moves having Seconday Effects for four turns This move, if used in Double/Triple Battles with Grass Pledge, will damage the opponents by 1/8th of their total Hit Points for four turns. If the opponents are of the Fire-Type, they don't receive damage

moves.name: firepunch
moves.battleEffect: The target is punched with a fiery fist. This may also leave the target with a burn.

moves.name: focusblast

moves.name: focusenergy
moves.battleEffect: The user takes a deep breath and focuses so that critical hits land more easily.

moves.name: foulplay

moves.secondaryEffect: Users the opponent's Attack stat in damage calculation
moves.inDepthEffect: This move utilises the opponent's current Attack stat into the calculation of this move. This takes status conditions and stat boosts/drops into consideration but does not include any boost from the opponent's ability.

moves.name: freezedry

moves.name: freezeshock

moves.secondaryEffect: May induce paralysis.

moves.name: frenzyplant
moves.battleEffect: The user slams the target with an enormous tree. The user can't move on the next turn.
moves.secondaryEffect: User cannot Attack on the next turn.

moves.name: frostbreath

moves.secondaryEffect: Always inflicts a Critical Hit

moves.name: frustration

moves.secondaryEffect: The less happy the user, the stronger the Attack.
moves.inDepthEffect: Frustration is the move that utilises the Happiness in the negative light, by rewarding the amount the Pokémon hates the trainer. It also is a Normal Type Physical Attack with 20PP and 100% accuracy and its power is calculated by the following means:   Base Power = (255 - Pokémon Happiness) / 2.5 This gives a maximum result of 102 and a minimum result of 1

moves.name: furyattack

moves.name: fusionbolt

moves.secondaryEffect: Doubles damage if ally used Fusion Flare this turn
moves.inDepthEffect: This move, if Fusion Flare has just been used this turn, will do double the damage.

moves.name: fusionflare

moves.secondaryEffect: Doubles damage if ally used Fusion Bolt this turn
moves.inDepthEffect: This move, if Fusion Bolt has just been used this turn, will do double the damage.

moves.name: futuresight

If the opponents are of the Fire-Type, they don't receive damage

moves.battleEffect: The user tackles the target with a high-speed spin. The slower the user compared to the target, the greater the move's power.
moves.secondaryEffect: Increases power the lower the target's Speed
moves.inDepthEffect: This attack's Base Power is anything from 1 up to 150 making it a very powerful attack to be used. However, this is completely dependant on your Pokémon's Speed as well as the Speed of your target. First, the user & targets speeds are claculated. Their Speed Stat is taken into account as well as other effects such as previous attack effects that my have raised or lowered speed, whether the Pokémon is Paralyzed and whether or not it is holding an item that lowers Speed such as the Power Items used to train EVs or an Iron ball. With these statistics now calculated, a simple equation is made to determine the base power of the attack Base Power = 25 * (TargetSpeed / UserSpeed) With this equation, it is very easy to see that if the user has a considerably lower speed, due to being a slow Pokémon or just being unlucky and having had loads of attacks that have lowered speed used on it as well as being Paralyzed and holding an Iron Ball, it will do considerable damage. However, even if the Base Power calculation obtains an amount that is greater than 150, you will never have more than that.

The item cannot be recovered with Recycle If the Pokémon is holding an item that cannot be removed, such as Giratina with the Griseous Orb, Arceus holding any of its plates or a Pokémon who is holding a Mega Stone needed for it to Mega Evolve, then the move will not do extra damage and they will not lose the hold item. If the user is knocked out from recoil caused by the opponent's hold item or ability, then the opponent will keep the hold item. If the target has got the Sticky Hold ability, the damage will be increased, but the opponent will not lose the hold item.

If Sunny Day is in effect, this move heals the user by 66.66% of its maximum Hit Points and if Rain Dance, Hail or Sandstorm is in effect, this move heals the user by 25% of their maximum Hit Points

moves.name: protect
moves.battleEffect: Enables the user to evade all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.

moves.inDepthEffect: If used in succession with other protection moves, its success rate is cut to 33% of what it was, working cumulatively the more it's used. This will prevent damage and effects of almost all possible attacks that would be inflicted upon the user. There are a few moves and abilities which do break through this move The following moves are also unaffected by Protect & Detect: Doom Desire (delayed damage only), Future Sight (delayed damage only), Feint, Hyperspace Fury, Hyperspace Hole, Imprison, Perish Song, Phantom Force, Psych Up, Shadow Force, Transform

moves.name: psyshock

moves.secondaryEffect: Inflicts physical damage

moves.name: psystrike

moves.name: pulverizingpancake

moves.secondaryEffect: No effect.

moves.name: punishment
moves.battleEffect: The more the target has powered up with stat changes, the greater the move's power.
moves.secondaryEffect: Increases damage inflicted based on the opponent's stat boosts
moves.inDepthEffect: Punishment has a rather low Base Power to start of with, the game believes that it is 1, which is the value set for attacks that have varying power such as this, Gyro Ball, Fling and so forth. Now, for every boost in stats that the opponent has, the Base Power for Punishment is boosted by 20. This is for Attack, Defense, Special Defense, Special Attack & Speed. For example, if the opponent has used Calm Mind, its Special Attack & Special Defense both will have been raised one level. This would give Punishment a boost of 40 in Base Power each time Calm Mind is used. Many movesets have people utilising this move or other moves such as this and then passing them on through Baton Pass, overall the power soon stacks up giving Punishment a massive boost. However, Punishment's Base Power is capped at 200.

moves.name: purify

moves.name: quickguard

moves.inDepthEffect: Unlike Protect, which works on all moves, Quick Guard prevents all effects from moves with a heightened Speed Priority. In addition to that, it also protects all the player's Pokémon on the field rather than just the user. However, even though it blocks all moves with a Speed Priority of 1 or higher. In addition to that, the move Feint will hit through this move, as it does with Protect and Detect.

moves.name: return

It is a Normal Type Physical Attack with 20PP and 100% accuracy. Its power is calculated by the following means:   Base Power = Pokémon Happiness / 2.5 This gives a maximum result of 102 and a minimum result of 1

moves.secondaryEffect: May induce paralysis.

moves.name: thundershock
moves.battleEffect: A jolt of electricity crashes down on the target to inflict damage. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
moves.secondaryEffect: May induce paralysis.

moves.name: thunderwave
moves.battleEffect: The user launches a weak jolt of electricity that paralyzes the target.
moves.secondaryEffect: Induces Paralysis

moves.name: tickle
moves.battleEffect: The user tickles the target into laughing, reducing its Attack and Defense stats.
moves.secondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Attack and Defense one stage.

moves.name: topsyturvy
moves.battleEffect: All stat changes affecting the target turn topsy-turvy and become the opposite of what they were.
moves.secondaryEffect: Inverts all stat alterations on the target.

moves.name: torment
moves.battleEffect: The user torments and enrages the target, making it incapable of using the same move twice in a row.
moves.secondaryEffect: Opponent cannot use the same move in a row.

moves.name: toxic
moves.battleEffect: A move that leaves the target badly poisoned. Its poison damage worsens every turn.
moves.secondaryEffect: Induces severe poison.

moves.name: toxicspikes
moves.battleEffect: The user lays a trap of poison spikes at the feet of the opposing team. The spikes will poison opposing Pokémon that switch into battle.

moves.name: toxicthread
moves.battleEffect: The user shoots poisonous threads to poison the target and lower the target's Speed stat.
moves.secondaryEffect: Inflicts Poison. Lowers opponent's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: transform
moves.battleEffect: The user transforms into a copy of the target right down to having the same move set.
moves.secondaryEffect: User transforms to the opponent.
moves.inDepthEffect: Transform can change many features of the Pokémon temporarily. The features are as follows; Pokémon Species Pokémon Cry Attack Stat Defense Stat Speed Stat Special Attack Stat Special Defense Stat Stat Changes EXP Yield Pokémon MovesAs such, this means that apart from its HitPoints and Level, Ditto/Mew is essentially the other Pokémon. However, due to this, its special items; Metal Powder & Quick Powder will stop working, and all other species items may work if you transform into the correct species. For example, if you had a Ditto with a Light Ball and you transformed into a Pikachu. the Light Ball would increase Ditto's Attack & Special Attack stats. Also, the EV training that you have put on Ditto becomes void for this battle. However, that said, when Critical Hits happen, it will still be based upon Ditto/Mew's stats. As the Pokémon's catch rate changes, if you wish to capture a Ditto or a Mew (Level 30 in Emerald will know Transform, although it isn't too likely to use it) with greater ease, then send in a Pokémon with a high capture rate such as Magikarp in battle first and then it should be very simple to capture. Its EXP Yield also changes so the EXP gained from beating a Ditto depends upon the Pokémon it has transformed into.
moves.detailedEffect: Heals the Hit Points of this Pokémon by 25%

moves.name: triattack
moves.battleEffect: The user strikes with a simultaneous three-beam attack. May also burn, freeze, or paralyze the target.
moves.secondaryEffect: May induce burn, freeze or paralysis.

moves.name: trick
moves.battleEffect: The user catches the target off guard and swaps its held item with its own.
moves.secondaryEffect: Switches items with the opponent

moves.name: trickortreat
moves.battleEffect: The user takes the target trick-or-treating. This adds Ghost type to the target's type.
moves.secondaryEffect: Target gains the Ghost-type

moves.name: trickroom
moves.battleEffect: The user creates a bizarre area in which slower Pokémon get to move first for five turns.
moves.secondaryEffect: Inverts the turn order in each Speed Priority bracked for 5 turns.

moves.name: triplekick
moves.battleEffect: A consecutive three-kick attack that becomes more powerful with each successive hit.
moves.secondaryEffect: Attacks 1-3 times in a row.

moves.name: tropkick
moves.battleEffect: The user lands an intense kick of tropical origins on the target. This also lowers the target's Attack stat.
moves.secondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Attack one stage.

moves.name: trumpcard
moves.battleEffect: The fewer PP this move has, the greater its power.
moves.secondaryEffect: Increases power the lower its PP

moves.name: twineedle
moves.battleEffect: The user damages the target twice in succession by jabbing it with two spikes. This may also poison the target.
moves.secondaryEffect: Attacks twice. May induce poison.

moves.name: twinkletackle
moves.battleEffect: The user creates a very charming space using its Z-Power and totally toys with the target. The power varies, depending on the original move.
moves.secondaryEffect: No effect.

moves.name: twister
moves.battleEffect: The user whips up a vicious tornado to tear at the opposing Pokémon. This may also make them flinch.
moves.secondaryEffect: May cause opponent to flinch. Damage is doubled if opponent is using Fly.

moves.name: uproar
moves.battleEffect: The user attacks in an uproar for three turns. During that time, no Pokémon can fall asleep.
moves.secondaryEffect: Hits for 3 turns. No Pokémon can be Asleep during that time.

moves.name: uturn
moves.battleEffect: After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
moves.secondaryEffect: Pokémon switches out from battle

moves.name: vacuumwave
moves.battleEffect: The user whirls its fists to send a wave of pure vacuum at the target. This move always goes first.
moves.secondaryEffect: Has increased Speed Priority

moves.name: vcreate
moves.battleEffect: With a hot flame on its forehead, the user hurls itself at its target. This lowers the user's Defense, Sp. Def, and Speed stats.
moves.secondaryEffect: Lowers user's Defense, Special Defense & Speed one stage.

moves.name: venomdrench
moves.battleEffect: Opposing Pokémon are drenched in an odd poisonous liquid. This lowers the Attack, Sp. Atk, and Speed stats of a poisoned target.
moves.secondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Attack, Special Attack & Speed one stage if Poisoned.

moves.name: venoshock
moves.battleEffect: The user drenches the target in a special poisonous liquid. This move's power is doubled if the target is poisoned.
moves.secondaryEffect: Doubles damage inflicted if target is Poisoned

moves.name: vicegrip
moves.battleEffect: The target is gripped and squeezed from both sides to inflict damage.
moves.secondaryEffect: No effect.

moves.name: vinewhip
moves.battleEffect: The target is struck with slender, whiplike vines to inflict damage.
moves.secondaryEffect: No effect.

moves.name: vitalthrow
moves.battleEffect: The user attacks last. In return, this throw move never misses.
moves.secondaryEffect: Cannot miss. Goes last.

moves.name: voltswitch
moves.battleEffect: After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
moves.secondaryEffect: Pokémon switches out from battle

moves.name: volttackle
moves.battleEffect: The user electrifies itself and charges the target. This also damages the user quite a lot. This attack may leave the target with paralysis.
moves.secondaryEffect: User receives 1/3rd of damage in re-coil. May PARALYZE opponent.

moves.name: wakeupslap
moves.battleEffect: This attack inflicts big damage on a sleeping target. This also wakes the target up, however.
moves.secondaryEffect: Heals the target from Sleep

moves.name: waterfall
moves.battleEffect: The user charges at the target and may make it flinch.
moves.secondaryEffect: May cause opponent to flinch.

moves.name: watergun
moves.battleEffect: The target is blasted with a forceful shot of water.
moves.secondaryEffect: No effect.

moves.name: waterpledge
moves.battleEffect: A column of water strikes the target. When combined with its fire equivalent, its power increases and a rainbow appears.
moves.secondaryEffect: If combined with Fire Oath, increases likelihood of Secondary Effects by 30% for four turns.
moves.inDepthEffect: This move, if used in Double/Triple Battles with Fire Pledge, will create a rainbow which doubles the changes of moves having Seconday Effects for four turns This move, if used in Double/Triple Battles with Grass Pledge, will create a marsh which reduces the speed of all opponents by 50% for four turns.

moves.name: waterpulse
moves.battleEffect: The user attacks the target with a pulsing blast of water. This may also confuse the target.
moves.secondaryEffect: May induce Confusion

moves.name: watershuriken
moves.battleEffect: The user hits the target with throwing stars two to five times in a row. This move always goes first.
moves.secondaryEffect: Attacks 2-5 times in a row. 37.5% chance of 2 hits. 37.5% chance of 3 hits. 12.5% chance of 4 hits. 12.5% chance of 5 hits Power increased by 50% if Battle Bond has activated.

moves.name: watersport
moves.battleEffect: The user soaks the battlefield with water. This weakens Fire-type moves for five turns.
moves.secondaryEffect: Lowers the power of Fire-type moves used on this Pokémon

moves.name: waterspout
moves.battleEffect: The user spouts water to damage opposing Pokémon. The lower the user's HP, the lower the move's power.
moves.secondaryEffect: Inflicts more damage when the user's HP is high.
moves.inDepthEffect: Power wise, this attack has a Base Power of 150 but that completely changes all depending on the HP. This is calculated in the manner below: Base Power = (Current HP * 150) / Max HP This gives it a maximum power of 150 and a Minimum of 1.

moves.name: weatherball
moves.battleEffect: This attack move varies in power and type depending on the weather.
moves.secondaryEffect: Changes type and doubles power based on the weather in play

moves.name: whirlpool
moves.battleEffect: The user traps the target in a violent swirling whirlpool for four to five turns.
moves.secondaryEffect: Traps the opponent for 4 to 5 turns

moves.name: whirlwind
moves.battleEffect: The target is blown away, and a different Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a single Pokémon.
moves.secondaryEffect: Ends wild battles. Switches the opponent Pokémon in a trainer battle.

moves.name: wideguard
moves.battleEffect: The user and its allies are protected from wide-ranging attacks for one turn.
moves.secondaryEffect: Protects all Pokémon on your team from damage that'd hit both Pokémon for one turn
moves.inDepthEffect: Wide Guard protects against specific moves, specifically moves which have more than one target such as Surf & Earthquake. In addition to protecting the user, it protects all of the user's allies in battle for that turn. This effect doesn't just correspond to moves used by the opponent, but it also protects allies from damage from moves by other allies which would inadvertantly damage them, such as Surf which hits all neighbouring Pokémon. There are a few moves however, that it doesn't protect against; Clear Smog, Haze & Perish Song

moves.name: wildcharge
moves.battleEffect: The user shrouds itself in electricity and smashes into its target. This also damages the user a little.
moves.secondaryEffect: User takes recoil damage equal to 25% of the damage inflicted.

moves.name: willowisp
moves.battleEffect: The user shoots a sinister, bluish-white flame at the target to inflict a burn.
moves.secondaryEffect: Induces burn.

moves.name: wingattack
moves.battleEffect: The target is struck with large, imposing wings spread wide to inflict damage.
moves.secondaryEffect: No effect.

moves.name: wish
moves.battleEffect: One turn after this move is used, the user's or its replacement's HP is restored by half the user's max HP.
moves.secondaryEffect: In 1 turn, it heals whatever Pokémon is in this position on the field's Hit Points by 50% of the maximum Hit Points.

moves.name: withdraw
moves.battleEffect: The user withdraws its body into its hard shell, raising its Defense stat.
moves.secondaryEffect: Raises user's Defense one stage.

moves.name: wonderroom
moves.battleEffect: The user creates a bizarre area in which Pokémon's Defense and Sp. Def stats are swapped for five turns.
moves.secondaryEffect: Switches Defense & Special Defense for five turns for all Pokémon on the field

moves.name: woodhammer
moves.battleEffect: The user slams its rugged body into the target to attack. This also damages the user quite a lot.
moves.secondaryEffect: User takes recoil damage equal to a third of the damage inflicted.

moves.name: workup
moves.battleEffect: The user is roused, and its Attack and Sp. Atk stats increase.
moves.secondaryEffect: Raises user's Attack & Special Attack one stage.

moves.name: worryseed
moves.battleEffect: A seed that causes worry is planted on the target. It prevents sleep by making the target's Ability Insomnia.
moves.secondaryEffect: Changes the opponent's ability to Insomnia

moves.name: wrap
moves.battleEffect: A long body, vines, or the like are used to wrap and squeeze the target for four to five turns.
moves.secondaryEffect: Traps opponent.

moves.name: wringout
moves.battleEffect: The user powerfully wrings the target. The more HP the target has, the greater the move's power.
moves.secondaryEffect: Increases damage the higher the target's Hit Points
moves.inDepthEffect: This attack's Base Power is anything from 1 up to 110 making it a fairly powerful attack to be used. The means of determining the Base Power however is set based on the Opponent's Hit Points. The higher its hit points the better. This does not refer to the Base Stats for the Hit Points but rather the opponent's HP relative to its maximum at the current point in time. With this in mind, a simple equation is made to determine the base power of the attack Base Power = 110 * (Opponent's Current HP / Opponent's Max HP) So for example if we were battling a Max IV'd, Max EV'd Torterra at Level 100 and it had just over half its HP remaining, it would be as such Base Power = 110 * (215 / 394) = 60.03 (2 d.p.) This shows that the best time to use Wring Out & Crush Grip would be at the start of a battle with any Pokémon, whether it has just been switched in or the battle is just beginning, in order to get the maximum Base Power. As the battle progresses, the power behind Wring Out & Crush Grip diminshes

moves.name: xscissor
moves.battleEffect: The user slashes at the target by crossing its scythes or claws as if they were a pair of scissors.
moves.secondaryEffect: No effect.

moves.name: yawn
moves.battleEffect: The user lets loose a huge yawn that lulls the target into falling asleep on the next turn.
moves.secondaryEffect: Target falls asleep during the next turn.

moves.name: zapcannon
moves.battleEffect: The user fires an electric blast like a cannon to inflict damage and cause paralysis.
moves.secondaryEffect: May induce paralysis.

moves.name: zenheadbutt
moves.battleEffect: The user focuses its willpower to its head and attacks the target. This may also make the target flinch.
moves.secondaryEffect: May cause opponent to flinch.

moves.name: zingzap
moves.battleEffect: A strong electric blast crashes down on the target, giving it an electric shock. This may also make the target flinch.
moves.secondaryEffect: May cause opponent to flinch.
